column4: When I start up with my USB harddrive connected, Ubuntu will have it mounted as /media/sdb5.  When I hotplug it, it will show up as /media/usbdisk, which confuses all my programs which expect stuff to be at /media/sdb5, not usbdisk.  How can I fix this.  The only entry in /etc/fstab is for sdb5.  I have no idea where that usbdisk comes from.
and you could change it by making a udev rule.
Thanks for the pointer, I'll try to look that up
